results.justification: The document clearly states the research aims to enhance AES using keystroke logs and deep learning. It proposes a novel model (KAES) and outlines the experimental setup.

Sections 3 (Dataset, Feature Engineering, Problem Setup) and 5 (Experiment Settings) provide a detailed, step-by-step description of the study design, including data preparation, feature extraction, model training, and evaluation.
The document mentions using the CBAL dataset, but does not provide a direct link or instructions on how to access it. It states the data was collected as part of a 2013 study.
Since the data is not openly available, this criterion is not applicable.
Section 3.1 (Dataset) provides details about the dataset, including the number of essays, scoring dimensions, and scoring scale. Table 1 provides statistical information.
Section 3.1 describes the dataset collection process, mentioning it was collected as part of a larger CBAL Writing Study and used SBA principles.
The document states: "KAES model code1 has been released to advance future research in this domain."
The code is stated to be released, so this criterion is not applicable.
While the document mentions data preprocessing, it does not explicitly state whether the code for data preparation is shared.
The document describes the use of statistical tests (QWK), models (LGBM, CNN, LSTM), and mentions hyperparameter tuning.
The document reports QWK scores, including percentage improvements over baseline models (e.g., "KAES improves the average Quadratic Weighted Kappa (QWK) scores... by 4.54% and 2.68%, respectively.").
The study is primarily quantitative and does not include significant qualitative interpretation or subjective context.
Since there is no qualitative data analysis, this criterion is not applicable.
Results are presented in tables (Table 2 and Table 3) and discussed in Section 5.2, with clear comparisons to baseline models.
Section 5.3 (Exploring the Future) discusses limitations, such as the need for further feature engineering and validation on other datasets.
The document does not mention or provide a link to any preregistration.
